snippet: A bipartisan coalition won a 69-to-27 vote to require online retailers to collect sales taxes for state and local governments. But antitax forces hope the House will kill the measure.
abstract: Bipartisan coalition in Senate passes legislation, 69-to-27, to force Internet retailers to collect sales tax for state and local governments, sending issue to House, where antitax forces have vowed to kill it; vote gives measure significant momentum.
lead_paragraph: A bipartisan coalition won a 69-to-27 vote to require online retailers to collect sales taxes for state and local governments. But antitax forces hope the House will kill the measure.

headline.main: Senate Passes Bill to Widen Tax Collection on the Web
headline.print_headline: Senate Passes Bill to Widen Tax Collection On the Web
